text:
Ro: Hey guys, it’s Ro! Welcome to another
Nerdy Nummies! Today I have a special guest

Ro: and friend, Kevin! Kevin: Hi. Ro: He runs
Vsauce 2, so I’ll put his link down

Ro: below so you can go check out Vsauce 2,
I’ll also put the other sauces down there.

Kevin: Might as well check out all the sauces.
Ro: Yeah! So down below it’s a little

Ro: saucy, go check out all the sauces. Kevin:
This will be a sauce party!

Ro: Yeah, saucy! And today, we are gonna be
making nerdy glasses.

Ro: Out of cookies! Kevin: Oh. Ro: And hard
candy. Kevin: Sounds good.

Ro: Are these edible? Kevin: I had… Ro:
Are these the cookies we made?
Kevin: You can try it.

Ro: The things you will need, will be: 1 large
mixing bowl, 1 packet of sugar cookie

Ro: mix, or your favorite sugar cookie recipe,
black dye, 1 stick of butter, an egg,

Ro: some flour, Jolly Rancher hard candies,
and these are peppermint hard candies,

Ro: I’m using these because they are clear,
they melt clear. 1 glasses cookie

Ro: cutter, I found this 1 at target, I’ll
put a link down below and…

Kevin: You’re also going to need a rolling
pin, a giant scary knife… Ro: Uh huh!

Kevin: A pancake flipper, a large robot monocle,
a small robot monocle and some

Kevin: weird dentist scary tool. Ro: A pokey,
thingy…
Kevin: And a mixer. Ro: And a mixer! Kevin: Don’t forget! Ro: Alright, let’s put this all together!

Kevin: Like this. Ro: Like this, this is how
you bake cookies.

Ro: Now, we are going to make our sugar cookie
mix. You’re gonna take that.

Ro: Go Kevin, go! Kevin: You have to rip it
off very manly-ish. Ro: Nice!
Kevin: Or else it doesn’t work!
Kevin: There you go. Ro: It worked!

Ro: Now we’re just gonna take this stick
of butter, plop it in there.

Ro: Do you know how to crack an egg? Kevin:
Yeah, oh yeah, you just smash it.

Ro: Alright. Kevin: Over your head right?
Ro: Uhhhhh,

Kevin: Look at this, this is… Ro: He trolled
me! Hey, hey! I’m supposed to troll you!

Ro: That’s my job. Kevin: Do I just rub
this on my shirt? Ro: Yeah!
Ro: Yeah, that’s how you wash your hands!

Ro: I’ll let you do the honors, you’re
just gonna put a spoonful of flour in there.

Kevin: OK, is that, is that good? Ro: Yeah! Kevin:
OK. Ro: Perfect! Kevin: Awesome.

Ro: And now I’ll add some dye, black food
coloring dye, and we’re gonna add a lot
Ro: because we want our cookie dough to be black.

Ro: That just sounds like little farts…
Kevin: Haha yeah. Mouse farts!

Ro: Listen to it! I’m trying to get the
microphone to hear it.
Kevin: Nerdy Nummies in the house!
Kevin: Makin’ farts like a mouse!
Ro: Maybe… Here, maybe I’m doing it wrong.
Ro: Here I'll let you. Kevin: You just… You gotta Hulk smash it!
Ro: OK, you Hulk sma… Oh…

Kevin: Is that enough? Ro: Gah, I need to
have you on more often!

Ro: Now we’re gonna mix it all up, using
a mixer, you can also use your hands,

Ro: but I’m gonna wait just a second, I’m
gonna use this first.
Ro: Yeah!
Ro: Perfect, perfect!
Kevin: Look out! Ro: It’s looking good!

Ro: Now that the cookie dough is all mixed
together, Kevin did an awesome job,

Ro: look at that, that’s what it should
look like.

Kevin: You’re welcome! Ro: Yeah, we’re
gonna get a little messy!

Ro: We’re gonna get our hands in there,
like this, OK. Like this and just massage it,

Ro: massage the dough. Kevin: Like a big meatball.
Ro: Yeah, until it looks like

Ro: a meatball. Kevin: A very scary, deadly
poisonous meatball!

Ro: Once you got your dough and you’ve been
working with it for awhile and it’s

Ro: ready to cut, you’re just gonna take
some flour, I’m gonna sprinkle it down on

Ro: the table. And move it around! And then
you just plop him on there. Perfect.

Ro: And then we’re gonna take the rolling
pin, and I’m just gonna sprinkle a little

Ro: bit of flour on top of the rolling pin,
just gonna roll out the dough!

Kevin: Roll out! Ro: The dough! Kevin: Roll
out! Ro: Merp-mer-mer!

Kevin: Roll out! Ro: Mer-mer-mer-mer! Kevin:
Roll out! Ro: Merp-mer-mer!

Kevin: I don’t think I’m as good at this…
Ro: No you’re doing good. Kevin: As you…
Ro: That is pretty good!
Kevin: It looks like Africa. Ro: Theres Egypt.

Kevin: Here’s South Africa, I know that
one!

Ro: Now you’re gonna take your glasses cookie
cutter, and we’re just gonna cut out

Ro: our glasses and put them on the cookie
sheet.

Ro: Wiggle, wiggle, wiggle! OK, now you take
off the excess dough.

Kevin: Look at this! Oh man, it looks like
an awesome beard! It looks perfect!

Ro: Oh wait, here, here, let me hold that
part up. It’s beautiful!

Ro: It’s beaut…. Now we’re gonna make
cookie beards!

Kevin: Velcome! To Nerdy Nummies! Ro: Velcome
to Nerdy Nummies!
Ro: Ha-ha oh no, oh no!
Ro: Take this, and we’re just gonna dee-dee-dee-dee!

Ro: And it’s OK if it gets a little squished
because when you put it on the
Ro: cookie tray, it will spread out again!

Ro: Now you’re gonna take your circle cookie
cutter, and cut out the inner parts of
Ro: the glasses… Doo-doo-doo-doo-doo!

Ro: And then with a toothpick, or, the sharp
little tool, you can just pick out the

Ro: middle. Now that we got our cookies cut
out, we are gonna be making the side

Ro: of the glasses… The legs? Arms? Kevin:
Yeah, the… Tentacles?

Ro: The tentacles that go on your little ear like
so.

Ro: So you can just cut out a shape, any shape
that you’d like.

Ro: Then you're gonna put it on top of the dough, take
your big cutting knife, and cut it out!

Ro: I’m just kind of eyeballing it, it doesn’t
have to be perfect and you can use a

Ro: toothpick to touch it up. And you’re
just gonna make a bunch of ‘em so

Ro: you’ll have enough for 2 for each glasses
cookie.

Ro: Then you’re gonna take your flipper
again and put them on the tray.

Ro: I don’t know if I should do this. Kevin:
Careful! Ro: Huwagh! Eghwap!

Kevin: I don’t know if you know what careful
means…

Ro: Now we are going to Hulk smash all of
our little hard candies. Kevin has got

Ro: the clear peppermint bag, hold those up.
And I’ve got the red Jolly Rancher bag!

Ro: Alright, do you want to go first? Kevin:
Yeah, of course! Ro: Alright, and then just
Ro: take a hammer, smash ‘em on the table!
Ro: Perfect, yeah!

Kevin: And then the cops come. Ro: And then
I get evicted.

Kevin: But we’ll have great Cookie Glasses!
Ro: Yeah we will!

Ro: Now you’re gonna take all your smashed
up hard candy, and we’re gonna put them
Ro: in the center of all of the glasses.

Ro: And it can overflow a little bit, because
when they melt, for some reason,
Ro: they melt very, very thin.

Ro: Now that our cookies are ready, you’re
gonna set your oven to 350 and bake for 6

Ro: minutes, so they bake really, really quickly,
just keep your eye on ‘em and

Ro: make sure that they’re on a piece of
wax paper!

Ro: Here are some of our cookies, they’re
fresh out of the oven, some of our other

Ro: ones are still cooling, but now we are
gonna do the final step to making

Ro; these little glasses! We are going to… Here,
Vannah these. Ahhhhh! Kevin: Bing!

Ro: We are gonna be using black chocolate
melts as candy, and I’ve just melted

Ro: some in a squeezie bottle, and we’re
gonna attach the um, the uh, what are they

Ro; called? Kevin: Well I did a little research
AKA googled, and these are actually

Kevin: called temples. Ro: Temples! Kevin:
So we learned something.

Ro: Yeah, we are going to glue on the temples
to the back of the glasses using
Ro: the hot chocolate, like so!

Ro: Ta-da! We did it! Here are all of our
glasses cookies, they’re so cute.

Ro: We left some of them just plain… Like
look at this one!
Ro: Na-na-nee-nee-na-new-nee-nee!
Ro: I can’t see through them though!

Ro; To look super sweet like this, subscribe!
Ha-ha just kidding!

Ro: Oh my gosh… That didn’t happen, that
didn’t happen!

Ro: And if this ever happens, it is no big
deal, because they’re very heavy

Ro: on each side, and very thin in the middle,
so all you have to do is take

Ro: a little bit of hot chocolate, and put
it in between and then Harry Potter them

Ro: back together! So don’t worry, if that
happens, it’s OK, it's easy to fix!

Ro: And, a big thank you again to Kevin for
being here and helping me make these!

Kevin: Yay! Ro: You did an awesome job! Kevin:
Oh thanks, I try, you know.

Kevin: I figure I had some experience with
wearing glasses, I might as well make
Kevin: some edible ones.

Ro: Yes! I will put all of his links down
below so you can go check out all of the

Ro: Vsauces, but Vsauce 2 is pretty cool!
Kevin: In particular.

Ro: Oh yeah, oh yeah! Yeah, and if you have
any other ideas for any other

Ro: Nerdy Nummies, please let me know, leave
me a comment down below and I will
Ro: do my best to make it happen!
Ro: OK, bye-bye!
Ro: Mee-mee-mee-mee-mee!
Ro: Meep-meep!
Background: They do look pretty good.
Ro: Yeah they do!
